_header: Our Lady free on Rood tree made Her moan
Note:
For other MSS that prefix an introductory stanza see 3956. For an edition not based on a specific MS, see Fein (1998)
XFein, Susanna Greer. Moral Love Songs and Laments. Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1998.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, as speaker in debates; Cross; debates
_description: The Disputation between the Virgin Mary and the Cross — 13-line stanzas, ababababcdddc, with an introduction and conclusion in which the first eight lines are expanded to twelve short lines, aabccbddbeebfgggf

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Oure ladi freo on Rode treo made hire monHeo seide on þe
                    þe fruit of me is wo bigon…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And Marie preiȝers þat ben ful goodeGrant vs
                    þe lyf of grace. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
Explicit disputacio inter Mariam / Et Crucem. secundum Apocrasum.
                    (f. 316vc)

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
Oure ladi fre on rode tre made hir monHeo seide on þe þe
                    fruite of me is wo bigon…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…And marie preieres þat bene ful goodeGraunt vs þe
                    lyf of grace Amen
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title:
Here begynneþ A lamentacion þat vre / lady made to þe Cros
                    of hir soone (f. 124vb, rubric); Explicit disputacio inter Mariam
                        et Crucem / et est Apocrasum (f. 125vb)
